Competition, Trade and Indirect Tax and Disputes Team - Assisted in the following matters:
- A report on “Digital Companies and Abuse of Dominance”;

- WTO Dispute of India;

- Compliance Sheet for PDP Bill, 2019;

- Report on “Model: Selecting regulation for Mediation”;

- E-commerce & Competition

- Disputes and Direct Tax Advisory Team
(a) Drafted -

-List of dates for claims in various arbitrations

-Research Notes on various Arbitration Awards and judgements

(b) Researched on-
Various research propositions for arbitrations such as the effect of mutual delay on liquidated damages, Consolidation of arbitrations etc.

- Various research proposition for International taxation matters such as Article 15 DTAA Apportionment principle, Interpretative value of OECD Commentary etc.

- Various research proposition for Direct Tax Advisory relating to Section 9 (Service rendered in India), Section 153A, Section 149 etc

(c) Attended IBC hearings at NCLT

(d) Submitted a research assignment -'Tax Challenges in Digital Economy'

work.companyName: Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR), Ministry of Commerce
work.about:
- Department of Commerce Internship
(a) Submitted a report on Escape Clause Mechanism in International Trade law highlighting the application of safeguard in Global as well as different Trade Agreements (RTA, CEPA, FTA, CECA etc.)

(b) Economic Analysis of DGCI&S and DG(System) data for Anti-Dumping and Safeguards Measures.

(c) Attended workshops/seminars on:

(i) External Benchmarks

(ii) Trade Remedies and Dispute Settlement in FTAs

(iii) Calculation of Anti-Dumping Margin, Price Undercutting/Suppression and other aspects of costing in Anti-Dumping Investigation

work.companyName: Office of Additional Solocitor General of India, Mr. Aman Lekhi
work.about:
- Assisted in drafting notes on a host of subjects including Constitutional law, Criminal law and Taxation Law.
- Assisted in research regarding the various matters which came up for hearing before the Supreme Court of India such as

1. Powers and special responsibilities of the Administrator of the Union Territory of Puducherry

2. Permanent nature of the ordinances drafted when India and Burma (Temporary and Miscellaneous Provisions) Act, 1942 was in force

3. Constitutional Morality and Constitutional Trust

4. Pragmatic Federalism

5. Public Interest as an exception to Laches from Corpus Juris Scendum

6. Wednesbury Principle of Reasonableness and Proportionality
